subSections.title: Etymology 1
subSections.text: Cognate with {{och-l|江|river}} ({{zh-ref|Schuessler, 2007}}). The southern dialectal word originally meant "small river/stream", which is still preserved in some [[w:Min Chinese|Min languages]]. The irregular pronunciation in Mandarin (expected Mandarin reflex is ''*jiǎng'') originated from southern dialects where velars have not [[w:Palatalization_(sound_change)#Mandarin_Chinese|palatalized]] ({{zh-ref|Schuessler, 2007}}).
